briefdescription.para: Global variables for test execution state.

detaileddescription.para: These globals maintain state throughout test execution including test counters, result storage, and configuration flags.
These static variables provide known test values and are used to verify proper static variable handling by the compiler.

Comprehensive BCPL Compiler Test Suite
M. Richards (original), BCPL Compiler Team (modifications)
Id
cmpltest.bcpl,v 1.2 2004/12/09 20:39:40 rn Exp
Copyright (c) BCPL Compiler Team. All rights reserved.
This is a universal code generator test program originally written by M. Richards to test the CII 10070 code generator. It has been adapted to thoroughly test the BCPL compiler's code generation capabilities across different target architectures.

sect2.title: Test Coverage
sect2.para:
The test suite validates:
Arithmetic Operations: All basic arithmetic and comparison operators
Control Flow: Conditional statements, loops, and jumps
Function Calls: Parameter passing, return values, recursion
Memory Operations: Variable access, array operations, pointer arithmetic
Data Types: Constants, variables, vectors, and string handling
Language Features: Pattern matching, valof expressions, etc.

sect2.title: Test Methodology
sect2.para:
Each test compares expected results with actual compiler output, tracking success/failure counts and providing detailed diagnostics for any failures. The test results validate the correctness of:
OCODE generation by the frontend
Code generation by the backend
Runtime behavior of generated code

sect2.title: Usage
sect2.para: Run the test suite after building the compiler to verify correctness: make-Ctoolstest
